msbt.message: Hullo there! I'm Daisy Mae!Do you know my gram-gram, Joan? She seems to know an awful lot of folks, so I always ask. Anyway, she said I'm old enough now to help out with the family business, so here I am! Oh! I forgot to tell you what the family business is.It's sellin' turnips! Have you heard of Sow Joan's Stalk Market?Well, I'll be here every Sunday mornin' with a fresh crop of turnips, so come say hi anytime!
G'morning!You here to start your Sunday off with some fresh turnips?
Ah, phooey, Daisy Mae. You forgot the sales pitch!Gram-Gram's told me enough times, I oughta remember how this goes by nowSodo you wanna hear about how Sow Joan's Stalk Market works?
Yes, please!
No, thanks.
Oh, are you sure?Whew, that's a relief! I'm still learnin' what half of this stuff means. A-heeheehee!

Umm OK, you can do thisSo! Turnips are a cute li'l root vegetable that are good for picklin' or stewin' Ack! Gram-Gram always says that the stalk-market turnips are for sellin', not eatin'. I always forget! Anyway, if you time things right, they can be mighty nutritious for your bank account! Should I keep goin' with the explanation?
Let's hear it!
I'm good.
A-heeheehee! I don't blame ya! Gram-Gram is always talkin' folks' ears off about turnips.

OK!<10_4 /> Now, let's see thenOh yeah! The whole point of buyin' our turnips is so you can turn around and sell 'em at a profit. Gram-Gram always says somethin' about 'em "turnin' up" a profit.<10_4 /> I don't exactly get it. Anyway, you know Timmy, right? He's always in the market for buyin', when it comes time for you to be sellin'. Should I keep goin'?
Let's hear it!
I'm good.

OK, this is a real important part, so I'm gonna try my best to explain carefully You don't wanna buy these turnips and keep 'em for too long. They'll rot after one week! So if you buy some from me on a Sunday, you gotta remember to sell 'em before the NEXT Sunday. Gram-Gram always says there's nothin' worse than a tent full o' rotten turnips, but it ain't true. Losin' all those hard-earned Bells you spent on 'em is worse!<10_4 /> OK! That's the whole speech.

Great! How many should I put you down for? They're each, but we sell in bundles of 10.
Aw, shucks. It doesn't look like you have the space to carry any turnips right now. If you wanna make some room and then come back and see me, I'll be here!
Oh, changed your mind? <10_4 />That's OK! There's always next Sunday.
Alright, so turnips comes to. Does that sound OK to you?
Yeah, I'll buy 'em!
I changed my mind.
A-heeheehee! Come again!
Turnips, turnips! Watch 'em rise! Try to earn a nice surprise!
Okeydoke! Maybe next time.
Oh! Uh I'm real sorry, but I don't think you actually have enough Bells for that many turnips.
Aw, shucks. You don't have enough room to carry all of those turnips. Story of my life!

OK, sometimes I still get things mixed up, but I'm gonna try my best to tell you everything! My gram-gram Joan's turnips are grown with pride and harvested with love. But, for whatever reason, most folks aren't interested in eatin' 'em. They buy 'em and re-sell 'em!

So, here on , Timmy will always buy fresh turnips from you. And the price changes every day! Sometimes they're worth a lot, and other times not so much. So if you buy 'em cheap and sell 'em for a lot, you can make a lot of Bells! And if you do it the other way around, well Let's just say that you probably don't wanna do that!
And the last part, which Gram-Gram always says is real importantThe turnips won't keep forever. They'll rot after one week and you won't be able to sell 'em!

I think that's everything Oh! Gram-Gram always wants me to mention the official brand name. It's Sow Joan's Stalk Market. She thinks it's real cute. A-heeheehee!Anyway, I'll be here every Sunday sellin' turnips. I hope we can do business together!
Hullo there! I'm Daisy Mae!I'm helpin' Gram-Gram Joan out, sellin' her garden-grown turnips.I'm here every Sunday mornin' selling turnips. So swing on by to see me when you can!
